content.raw: I removed the dependency on webkit. We were using `QWebView` in a single place to view a hotkey table. Instead of maintaining the hotkey html both [online](http://gazebosim.org/hotkeys.html) and in gazebo's source, the `HotKey` help menu item now open a webpage to `http://gazbosim.org/hotkeys.html`.
content.html: I removed the dependency on webkit. We were using QWebView in a single place to view a hotkey table. Instead of maintaining the hotkey html both online and in gazebo's source, the HotKey help menu item now open a webpage to http://gazbosim.org/hotkeys.html.

update.description:
This pull request replaces qt4 with qt5. Gazebo8 will only support qt5, and no version of gazebo will support both qt4 and qt5.

Changes include:

1. CMake switch from qt4 to qt5.
1. The renderFrame in GLWidget has been removed (not needed in qt5 - don't ask me why).
1. [Dual monitors cause Qt to spam the console with warnings](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/33545006/qt5-attempt-to-set-a-screen-on-a-child-window-many-runtime-warning-messages). My solution is to capture the output in `GuiIface.cc` with a custom message handler.
1. MainWindow start size was problematic (xenial + gnome). The startup size would hide the X11 window frame. Reworked the `MainWindow::Init` function to account for this. 
1. Numerous qt api changes.

[Jenkins no-gpu](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-no-gpu_ccache/34/console)

I'm working on the Windows side of things.

Please test this a lot.

Also please review [this release-tools](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/260) pull request, which jenkins requires.
update.title: Qt5

update.title: Qt5

content.raw:
it was from an email chain that you started:

~~~
Slight complication with Qt5.
I believe, and someone should confirm, that libqwt-qt5 is not released in trusty.
This means if we integrate both QT5 and Plotting into gazebo8,
we'd have to disable plotting for trusty or build gazebo with qt4 when using trusty.
~~~

Confirming that `libqwt-qt5-dev` is not in trusty:

* http://packages.ubuntu.com/xenial/libqwt-qt5-dev
content.html:
it was from an email chain that you started:

Slight complication with Qt5.
I believe, and someone should confirm, that libqwt-qt5 is not released in trusty.
This means if we integrate both QT5 and Plotting into gazebo8,
we'd have to disable plotting for trusty or build gazebo with qt4 when using trusty.

Confirming that libqwt-qt5-dev is not in trusty:

  • http://packages.ubuntu.com/xenial/libqwt-qt5-dev

content.raw:
[plugins aren't compiling](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/46/testReport/):

~~~
339: CMake Warning at CMakeLists.txt:4 (find_package):
339:   Found package configuration file:
339: 
339:     /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/cmake/Qt5/Qt5Config.cmake
339: 
339:   but it set Qt5_FOUND to FALSE so package "Qt5" is considered to be NOT
339:   FOUND.  Reason given by package:
339: 
339:   The Qt5 package requires at least one component
~~~
content.html:
plugins aren't compiling:

339:   Found package configuration file:
339:

339: 
339:   but it set Qt5_FOUND to FALSE so package "Qt5" is considered to be NOT
339:   FOUND.  Reason given by package:
339: 
339:   The Qt5 package requires at least one component

content.raw:
I have worked a bit on reducing warnings in Visual Studio, and all this GCC/Clang specific pragmas are creating `4068` warnings ( https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/w099eeey.aspx , note that they are enabled by default even at /W1 , the lowest warning level ). 

If reducing the number of warnings on Windows is a goal, we need to:

* either prepend all this pragma with `ifndef _MSC_VER`, 
* or disable the Visual Studio warning `4068` for Gazebo  at the CMake level.
content.html:
I have worked a bit on reducing warnings in Visual Studio, and all this GCC/Clang specific pragmas are creating 4068 warnings ( https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/w099eeey.aspx , note that they are enabled by default even at /W1 , the lowest warning level ).

If reducing the number of warnings on Windows is a goal, we need to:

  • either prepend all this pragma with ifndef _MSC_VER,
  • or disable the Visual Studio warning 4068 for Gazebo at the CMake level.
